Exaggerate: Sanders exaggerates the fraction of Walmart associates who are African American by stating that 42% of its associates are black, when the actual number is 22.2%.
Problematic assumption: Sanders assumes that the percentage of African American associates at Walmart is representative of racial equality in the workforce as a whole.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on an inaccurate statistic and does not provide additional evidence or data.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the claim, which is that the 42% figure includes all people of color, not just African Americans.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misrepresenting the percentage of African American associates at Walmart and making a factual error.
Understate: The claim may understate the racial diversity within Walmart by focusing solely on the percentage of African American associates.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the actual percentage of African American associates at Walmart is 22.2%, not 42% as stated by Sanders.
